title: Suddenly cannot send emails, except in Trouble-shooting mode
content: Hello! ... Suddenly I cannot send emails from Thunderbird. I still receive incoming emails as normal, and all other functions seem to work. But I cannot send. When I switch to Trouble-shooting mode, I can send emails, but when I switch back to regular mode, I can't send. I can save the email, but when I click "send" the send button and all the other buttons at the top of the window fade, and nothing happens. I have not changed any settings in Thunderbird or my email provider (Kolabnow). I have checked and the settings are exactly as Kolab requires: smtp.kolabnow.com .... Port 465 ... SSL/TLS. Thunderbird updates automatically, so I'm running the latest version. I'm on Mac OS 13.5.2 (Ventura). How do I fix this? Are others reporting the same problem? (I have tested and can still send emails from Kolab's web site, just not from Thunderbird.)
creator: pigeonsontheroof

title: Trouble connecting with The Messaging Co
content: With both the old and now new laptop, cannot get my mail from the messaging Co, but can from their weblink. Ongoing correspondence has given me the in and outgoing servers, all to no avail. This has been going on for over a year. Ingoing port 993. Outgoing 465 Very occasionally I get some mail come in, strangely enough. All outgoing comes back as "timed out" Any clues please. John
creator: meowngame

title: Unable to connect to my ISP email server - Thunderbird claiming wrong username/password or configuration problem
content:
Hi, I have been using Thunderbird for a long time and never had any issues until last Thursday. I was able to connect to my ISP email server but it ended up showing no new emails even though I know that I have emails as I am able to see them on my iPhone. So thinking that something changed, I removed my account details from Thunderbird and try to reconnect. The first stage, the detection of my ISP email server passed with no problems.

See the first attachment.

So after seeing this, I click on the Done button and then the problem arises.

See the second attachment.

Now to cover some other important information. I talked with my ISP and we checked the configuration manually that is shown in both attachments and they were completely correct to their files. No deviation in any manner. We trip POP3 and also IMAP settings and still got the same error as the second attachment. I and the tech support person from my ISP also checked the typing of my password, the original one and even the new password 10x. I also typed each character of my password slowly, just in case I typed it wrong having it visible to me and invisible to me and still got the same error as the second attachment. Also the images are from today January 29, 2025 approximately from the last 20 minutes. So this is fresh for an attempt to connect to my ISP email server, not just from some previous attempt.

Hopefully I can get a work around from the forum. Oh, one more thing I have the latest Mozilla Thunderbird that is available and that is Version 128.6.1esr (64-bit) as I had updated it before I attempted to connect to the ISP email server. I have done no uninstalls.
creator: pintaric

title: Best E-mail provider to use.
content:
The issue: I am 20 year Outlook (Microsoft Office Outlook version and I love it) user with Comcast/Xfinity email. I no longer use Comcast (Xfinity) as the Internet Service Provider. Xfinity/Comcast lets me keep the address (for an undetermined amount of time). Our new home Internet Service Provider is AT&T.

I have been running into issues with the “in and out box” on outlook. I get error messages that are way above my knowledge. But eventually emails leave (6:00PM to be exact). I am considering starting all over and getting away from the “way too complicated” Outlook.

My thoughts are; I need a new e-mail address and new software.

Question: If I choose Thunderbird, would it be best to open an AT&T/Yahoo email address? AT&T is going to be involved anyway since they are the I.S.P. I want to eliminate a player. The current players are Comcast/Xfinity – Outlook – AT&T. Your thoughts and suggestions are appreciated. I credit “Ask Leo” for recommending Thunderbird.

title: Thunderbird fails to enter correct FROM address when forwarding received email as attachment. FROM address should be the one which received the mail.
content:
When I receive email in Thunderbird software (128.6.0esr - latest stable for my distribution), right click it, select "Forward and Redirect" and then "As attachment", the FROM email address is set to my default SMTP server account email address (Edit > Account settings > scroll down to the bottom and click "Outgoing server (SMTP)" ).

On another hand when i just reply same email, it uses correct FROM address of mine (the one which received the mail). How to fix it so the Forwarding as attachment does not use my default email, but the email of mine, which received the now forwarded message?

I think that it should be default for privacy reason so TB does not help me accidentally "contaminate" my recipient identity with my main/default identity.

It looks like a slow network connection, but that is not the case.

I have not changed anything, restarted my PC, cleared the Thunderbird Cache, disabled my Anti-Virus/Firewall, but to no avail.

Is this related to the last update or/and is there something i can do to fix that?

Thanks

title: Some mails have empty bodies when forwarding oder 'edit(ed) as new' (TB on Linux)
content:
Dear community,

since few days I face empty mail bodies in the compose window when trying to forward some mails from my IMAP account. Same situation when trying to edit these mails 'as new'. Reply works fine.

It seems to only apply to mails that I have sent by myself before, not the ones received from others. HTML/TXT format does not make a difference.

My setup is Linux Mint 22 (Ubuntu 24.04), default TB 128.6.0esr (64-Bit). Roughly 9 GB IMAP mailbox with tons of folders. The only addons are 'Textmarker' and 'Quicktext'.

I've already deleted the IMAP cache folder completely to get it re-populated from scratch - no change. Since I use TB on Linux without problems for years, always on the latest Mint/Ubuntu and on three different devices I'd guess there could be a strange bug.

Does anybody else see something similar?

Greetings and thanks Ulrich

title: Working with collaborative Events
content:
Hey everyone,

I am trying to use Thunderbird for scheduling meetings, but I have problems understanding how. Let's say, we are a group of 5 people, all using Thunderbird as their Mail driver and managing our calendars in Thunderbird. When I create an event in my calendar and hit 'Invite Attendees', it opens a Window with a timeline and a list of mail addresses. First problem here: It has the mail account, which I added to Thunderbird most recently, prefilled instead of my primary mail account or the account connected to the calendar where I add the event to. I couldn't find a place to change this. But then, when I change it to a mail address connected to my calendars, I'd expect it to populate my timeline with the events in these calendars. But it stays empty. Also, when I add other people, it stays completely empty. I wasn't able to have anything appear in this timeline at any point. Where am I going wrong? How do I add my available and unavailable times for this timeline and share them with people, who might be interest to schedule me around them? I hope I could transmit my problems, if you have any questions, I'm glad to answer them.

Thanks a lot Carroll
creator: carroll.diehl

title: Recuperação de emails
content:
Bom dia.

Tenho algumas dúvidas para esclarecimento. Trabalho em uma empresa onde todos os emails institucionais são instalados no thunderbird, alguns dias atras foi trocado o provedor do site e precisei fazer algumas instalações em algumas maquinas, porém por desatenção minha não verifiquei se a maquina estava com a configuração pop ou imap e acabei excluindo o email e instalando novamente e ao perceber que os emails não retornaram analisei que a maquina estava na configuração pop. Minha dúvida é eu consigo recuperar esses email que estão na maquina? Pois eu tentei reinstalar em pop e mesmo assim os emails não retornam e ao analisar a pasta do perfil, percebi que o tamanho da pasta não mudou mas os emails não retornam para o thunderbird.

Desde já agradeço a atenção de todos!

title: Missing folders
content:
Problem: I installed thunderbird and added my employer's account. I used IMAP and ideally Exchange should be used. The problem is that I only have one folder. I have inbox, but I have no other folders.

Bug: I believe this bug is known. It is not fixed.

Payment: Thunderbird is the only real competition to Outlook. I would be willing to pay to keep this competitor alive. I applaud Owl's efforts, but I'm not sure I want an industry built around Thunderbird's flaws. If I'm going to pay, I'd like to pay for Thunderbird.

Two questions:

  1. Will Thunderbird be able to fix this problem in the foreseeable future?
  2. How do I replace Outlook? (I've tried Proton Mail, EM Mail, and Spark, but I found that they tried to differentiate themselves and emphasize things that were a bit far from what I needed.) I just want to replace Outlook, which annoys me by asking me to enter my password every morning.
